readability_reflection: I found concatenation to be more readable because it is easier to distinguish actual text from the names of variables (e.g. it is easier to know that b is a variable in ["Hello" + b ] than ["Hello {b}"]). String concatenation is also the first method I learned in my first computer science class at UNLV.
comprehension_debugging: Using string interpolation took more time to understand than using string concatenation. It was harder to distinguish text from the names of variables with interpolation as I was not as familiar with it.
preference_rationale: I would choose string concatenation for future programming tasks. This is because I have more experience with concatenation, and I did not know about string interpolation before this survey.
learning_curve: Prior to this survey, I had only learned and used string concatenation and have never encountered or heard of string interpolation. Therefore, it was more difficult to understand the examples that used interpolation.
